business.headline: Northern Arc Capital IPO allotment tomorrow: Check latest subscription, GMPNorthern Arc Capital Limited, founded in 2009, provides retail loans to underserved households and businesses across India.

Sensex, Nifty end higher after US Fed's 50 bps rate cut; NTPC gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 236.57 points higher at 83,184.80, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 38.25 points higher at 25,415.80. Both the indices had hit fresh all-time highs in early trade.
Government working on new income tax act. Check inside detailsThe new tax framework aims to replace the current 1961 act, simplifying the tax process for individuals and businesses.

RPSG's Firstsource expands globally, eyes $550 million boost from AIThe expansion is part of Firstsource's strategy to improve its business margins while continuing to create jobs in India. For every position created in Australia, the company plans to create three jobs in India.

Gold prices react to US Fed rate cut: What investors need to knowThe US Federal Reserve's rate cuts aim to stabilise the economy but raise concerns about their impact on global markets, particularly on gold prices, a key investment in uncertain times.

Cisco cuts thousands of jobs in second biggest layoff of 2024: Report This latest round of layoffs follows a previous cut in February when Cisco let go of about 4,000 employees.

US Fed cuts rates by 50 bps: How will it affect Indian stock market?This is the first time the Fed has reduced rates since 2020, and it has been done to address slowing economic growth and easing inflation in the US.

US Fed slashes rates by 50 bps in first rate reduction since 2020Policymakers see the Fed's benchmark rate falling by another half of a percentage point by the end of this year, another full percentage point in 2025, and by a final half of a percentage point in 2026 to end in a 2.75 per cent-3.00 per cent range.
US Fed rate decision today at 11:30 pm – 5 things to watch outMarkets are widely expecting a 25-basis-point cut in the key interest rate, marking the first reduction in four years.

Tupperware, once a household name, files for bankruptcyTupperware Brands and some of its subsidiaries filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on Tuesday. The company, widely known for its food storage containers, has been struggling with falling sales in recent years.

NPS Vatsalya: How to invest, eligibility criteria, and online buying guideNPS Vatsalya enables parents or guardians to open a pension account for minors and contribute as little as Rs 1,000 annually, making it accessible to families from various economic backgrounds.

Reliance Infra shares hit 20% upper circuit. What's next? The sharp uptick in Reliance Infra's share price followed the company's announcement of a significant reduction in its standalone external debt, from Rs 3,831 crore to Rs 475 crore.
Paytm shares cross Rs 700 for the first time since January. More room to rise?	Before today, the last time Paytm traded above Rs 700 was in late January, closing at Rs 761.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Israel launches strikes across Lebanon during Hezbollah chief's speech Live UpdatesIsrael Defense Forces (IDF) said that it is currently striking Hezbollah targets in Lebanon to degrade the terror group's capabilities and infrastructure.

Tirupati laddoos contain beef fat, fish oil, confirms lab reportA report by a private laboratory has revealed that the samples of the ghee used in making Tirupati laddoos contained foreign fat, including palm oil, fish oil, beef tallow and lard (obtained by rendering the fatty tissue of a pig).

Speculative, misleading: India on report of diversion of ammunition to UkraineThe Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has rejected the claims made by news agency Reuters that artillery shells sold by Indian arms makers were diverted by European customers to Ukraine.

EY India Chairman denies work pressure as reason for employee's death: ReportThe death of a 26-year-old Ernst & Young employee, Anna Sebastian Perayil, has sparked outrage after her mother's emotional letter went viral, raising concerns over work pressure within the company.
I hate you (like I love you), Emily in ParisEmily Cooper's French visa is not expiring anytime soon. She is going to be on Netflix, and in our lives, for a long time.

India reacts after US court summons government in plot to murder Gurpatwant PannunThe US District Court for Southern District of New York named the Government of India, National Security Advisor Ajit Doval, former R&AW chief Samant Goel, in the summons.

Israel didn't just rig Hezbollah pagers, it actually made those explosive pagersAfter thousands of pagers of Hezbollah fighters exploded in Lebanon, it was believed that Israel had somehow penetrated the supply chain and rigged the devices with explosives. However, jaw-dropping reports now suggest that Israel might have created shell companies that actually manufactured those explosive pagers for Hezbollah. Here's how it managed the unthinkable.

Food delivery agent ends own life after customer scolded him for delay in orderA 19-year-old food delivery executive died by suicide after being scolded by a customer for a delayed delivery in Chennai.

Can Kejriwal take AAP unity for granted?Politics is what takes place between what's said and what's left unsaid. Most AAP leaders said that Kejriwal would return after the election, and that's exactly why they have agreed to Atishi as the CM. What's unsaid is that Atishi is a stop-gap solution. But will AAP unity stand the test if Atishi continues as the CM? Will personal ambitions create a fissure within the ranks?

Sunita Williams turns 59: Astronaut celebrates birthday 400 km above EarthThis marks the second time Williams has celebrated her birthday in space, having previously done so during a 2012 mission.

Employee blames rats for hole in Delhi-Mumbai highway, company fires himThe firm stated that the comment was made by a junior employee who had no technical understanding regarding the project and confirmed that he had been terminated from the company.

Stree 2 has surpassed Jawan at box office but it's not what you think! Stree 2 is scripting history at the box office. But, there's one part of the story that's yet to be written: surpassing the lifetime collection of Jawan at the domestic ticket window.

Cannes winner All We Imagine As Light to release in limited screens in KeralaAll We Imagine As Light, a Grand Prix winner at the 77th Cannes Film Festival, will make its limited screen debut in Kerala on Saturday, September 21. Spirit Media has secured exclusive distribution rights for this Indo-French co-production.

Ben Stokes set to have scan on hamstring injury ahead of Pakistan tourEngland captain Ben Stokes is scheduled for a hamstring scan next week as the team evaluates his fitness for the upcoming Test series against Pakistan. The 33-year-old all-rounder has been sidelined since August due to the injury but remains active in training.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.
